alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 4:33PM MST until July 31 at 7:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 745 PM MST. * At 432 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain along the SR260 corridor between Cottonwood and Camp Verde. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... western portions of Camp Verde, Middle Verde, Cornville, Verde Village, Bridgeport and Cottonwood. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 207 and 219. Interstate 17 between mile markers 285 and 288. State Route 89A between mile markers 356 and 359. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Verde River, Oak Creek, Cherry Creek, Grief Hill Wash and Gaddis Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
